text: Kamila Żuk (born 18 November 1997) is a Polish biathlete. She competed at the 2018 Winter Olympics. ==Career== Kamila Żuk debuted at 2018 Olympic Games in PyeongChang in 2x6km Women + 2x7.5km Men mixed relay and finished on 16th place. On March 1, 2018, as the first Polish biathlete, she won the title of Junior World Champion in 12,5 km individual competition with a predominance of time more than 3 minutes. Two days later, she claimed another gold medal, this time in 7.5 km sprint ahead Czech Markéta Davidová and French Myrtille Bègue. On March 4, 2018 Żuk added silver medal to her achievements from 2018 Junior World Championships in 10 km pursuit, losing only with Czech Davidová at a loss 28.1 sec. ==Results== ===Olympic Games=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- " !Event !style="width:70px;"|Individual !style="width:70px;"|Sprint !style="width:70px;"|Pursuit !style="width:70px;"| !style="width:70px;"|Relay !style="width:70px;"| |- | align=left | |— |— |— |— |— | 16th |} ===Youth/Junior World Championships=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- " !Event !Individual !Sprint !Pursuit !Relay |- | align=left | 2015 Raubichi-Minsk | 50th | 13th | 58th | 9th |- | align=left | 2016 Cheile Grădiştei | 28th | 11th | 29th | 5th |- | align=left | 2017 Osrblie | 49th | 27th | 10th | 10th |- | align=left | 2018 Otepää | style="background:gold;"|Gold | style="background:gold;"|Gold | style="background:silver;"|Silver | 5th |} ===Youth/Junior Euroepan Championships=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- " !Event !Individual !Sprint !Pursuit !Relay |- | align=left | 2016 Pokljuka | 37th | 6th | 8th | — |- | align=left | 2017 Nové Město | 8th | style="background:#cfaa88;"|Bronze | 12th | — |- |} ==References== Category:1997 births Category:Living people Category:Biathletes at the 2018 Winter Olympics Category:Polish female biathletes Category:Olympic biathletes of Poland Category:People from Wałbrzych
